channel.title: Recommend me some movies
channel.description:
So, I've never been much of a cinephile and I want to correct that asap.
Could you suggest some movies that I NEED to watch? no specific genre

item.title: Recommend me some movies
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Kairouseki:

Where did you find it? I looked everywhere and I doubt they’d have it at any video rental store. And the ending might have came out of nowhere since the movie was originally 8 hours long and they practically cut it in half for the longest version that can be seen now.

I watched it in college for a film history class. :s

It was a feature length cut. It didn’t feel like anything was missing.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me some movies
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
It’s almost Christmas. If you celebrate this holiday (and even if you don’t), I recommend the following Christmas movie:

National Lampoon’s Christmas Vacation.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me some movies
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
I tried watching 2010 and just couldn’t. I liked the ending to 2001 and 2010 just ruined all the stuff about the first movie for me. And the filming style was totally different due to a different director and it looked lower budget to me somehow. Just everything about the movie turned me off.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me some movies
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
Kairouseki:

And screw you, 2001 is 2.5 hours of quality movie .

2001 is a movie about space with a subplot about a monolith.Space is not a mystery to me like it was to the world when the movie was made. I don’t like it for this reason. I can’t understand and respect the movie for what it is, but watching it is a chore.

I actually like 2010 better. It’s a movie about a monolith that is set in space, and the ending actually makes sense (probably because the script was written and finished before they started filming ).

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me some movies
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
I don’t know, I haven’t watched it. The Wikipedia article says that only 12 people saw the 8 hour cut of the movie and they apparently called it the best movie ever made and couldn’t imagine a better one ever being made. I’d take that with a grain of salt though.

And screw you, 2001 is 2.5 hours of quality movie .

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me some movies
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Kairouseki:

According to IMDB the original cut of the movie was 210 minutes while the restored version is 145 minutes. Wikipedia (and it’s on IMDB too) says 153 minutes for the original though, which sounds closer.

From Wikipedia.

I’m also interested in a silent movie called Greed, which apparently was around 10 hours long when it was filmed. Apparently a janitor cleaning up the place where it was stored threw it away or burned it or something though.

I saw Greed. It was pretty cool. I recommend you watch it, but be warned: the ending comes out of fucking nowhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me some movies
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Yeah, a lot of old movies and shows have been permanently lost because the tapes are missing, destroyed, or just worn out with age. I think some of the earliest episodes of doctor who are gone for this reason, among many others.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me some movies
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
According to IMDB the original cut of the movie was 210 minutes while the restored version is 145 minutes. Wikipedia (and it’s on IMDB too) says 153 minutes for the original though, which sounds closer.

The print was in poor condition and required considerable restoration before it was re-premiered in February 2010. Two short sequences from the film, depicting a monk preaching in the cathedral and a fight between Rotwang and Fredersen, were in extremely poor condition and could not be salvaged

From Wikipedia.

I’m also interested in a silent movie called Greed, which apparently was around 10 hours long when it was filmed. Apparently a janitor cleaning up the place where it was stored threw it away or burned it or something though.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me some movies
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
^
Except for the mediary bullshit. That was so fucking hamfisted and corny even for the time. In fact, I think that’s what most of the reviewers hated about it too :s

They just recovered a shitload of it last year. There’s only a few frames missing now.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me some movies
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Pyro:

Isn’t Metropolis that really old sci-fi movie with some of the footage missing?

It’s still got a little bit missing but most of the footage was restored. They had a premier in Germany this year or last that I found a recording of and it was pretty cool. You might be able to find it on piratebay still. You should watch it if you can, it’s really good.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me some movies
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
danielsangeo:

If you like screwball comedies (unfortunately, I do; it’s a weakness of mine), might I suggest the 1970s flick “What’s Up Doc?”

Yeah, I know it has Barbra Streisand in this but she’s actually okay in this. It’s also Madeline Khan’s first feature-length movie and it has, as the judge–in a great casting choice–Liam Dunn (the preacher from “Blazing Saddles”). In fact, the movie has a very Mel Brooksian feel to it even though it wasn’t made by him.

If you haven’t seen it, I highly recommend it.

I love that movie. I am tempted to watch it right now…

Read full topic
